thread.title: Irish eyes are unsmiling as Daniel O'Donnell voted off Strictly
thread.title_full: Irish eyes are unsmiling as Daniel O'Donnell voted off Strictly

title: Irish eyes are unsmiling as Daniel O'Donnell voted off Strictly
text:
Irish eyes are unsmiling as Daniel O'Donnell voted off Strictly Irish eyes are unsmiling as Daniel O'Donnell voted off Strictly 
  
Irish singer Daniel Oâ€™Donnell has become the third celebrity to waltz out of Strictly Come Dancing â€“ but said it was â€œthe right time for me to goâ€. 
Daniel, 53, and his partner Kristina Rihanoff faced sports presenter Kirsty Gallacher and Brendan Cole in the dance-off, but mistakes in the routine saw Oâ€™Donnell being sent home. 
He and Kristina performed the American Smooth to Frank Sinatraâ€™s Fly Me To The Moon and the star admitted: â€œI forgot everything in the dance-off, my feel stuck to the floor.â€ Daniel and Kristina (BBC Pictures) 
He added: â€œIâ€™ve had a great time, I have enjoyed the show, to have been asked to go on it was amazing. 
â€œAnd to just have taken part, itâ€™s going to be lovely to look back and say â€˜I was on that show.â€™â€ 
He admitted his nerves got the better of him, and said he was surprised at how nervous he got each week. 
â€œIâ€™ve done shows for so many years and have been on stage, it kind of took me by surprise, but I suppose I was out of my comfort zone and thatâ€™s why I felt so nervous,â€ he explained. 
Fans from Ireland canâ€™t vote for Strictly Come Dancing contestants, but Oâ€™Donnell didnâ€™t feel that was a contributing factor to him leaving. Promoted stories Kirsty and Brendan (Guy Levy/BBC) 
â€œI donâ€™t think thereâ€™s any issue there at all, the show is based in the UK, you know itâ€™s based here in the UK and itâ€™s a UK show. If anything I suppose it would be unfair if one person from Ireland was in a show and everybody else was from the UK and all of the votes, or most of the votes (from Ireland) were going for me,â€ he said. 
Earlier in the week, Kristina blasted a report that claimed sheâ€™d branded Oâ€™Donnell â€œan old manâ€ and said he was unlikely to win. 
She wrote on Twitter: â€œEveryone knows how much we enjoy working together! Rude journalism.â€ 
Talking about the incident, Oâ€™Donnell said: â€œWhat can you do, things are going to be written â€“ it certainly didnâ€™t affect Kristina and myself at all, we just enjoyed learning the dance, doing the dances, and I suppose I would have loved to be able to do better. Somebody has to go every week and this week it was my turn.â€ Thank you so much everyone for your words for Daniel and I!! All of your support and votes very appreciated!!! ğŸ€ğŸ€ğŸ€ 
â€” Kristina Rihanoff (@KRihanoff) October 17, 2015 
He also added light-heartedly: â€œI donâ€™t think Iâ€™m old!â€ 
In Saturday nightâ€™s show, professional dancer Gleb Savchenko whipped his top off, but Oâ€™Donnell joked he was â€œdelightedâ€ heâ€™d not be getting his off soon. Gleb and Anita (Guy Levy/BBC) 
â€œI think Iâ€™m doing the world a favour, or maybe the lack of votes is doing the world a favour,â€ he said. 
After dancing off against Kirsty and Brendan, who performed their Paso Doble to U2â€²s Beautiful Day, judge Craig Revel Horwood said: â€œOne couple did really, really well in the dance-off and one couple I am afraid made a lot of mistakes. 
â€œI am going for the couple that was the most powerful, and that was Kirsty and Brendan.â€ 
Judges Darcey Bussell and Bruno Tonioli agreed, saying: â€œI would like to keep the couple that committed less mistakes tonight, and that is Kirsty and Brendan.â€ 
The latest ratings figures show that Strictly continues to dominate Saturday night TV, with the show peaking at 10.6 million viewers, with an average of 9.7 million tuning in. Share article 
The remaining twelve couples will take to the dancefloor once more next week when Strictly Come Dancing returns on Saturday 24 October at 6.35pm, with the results show on Sunday 25 October at 7.15pm on BBC One. Promoted Stories
